metadata.title: CVE-2012-4455 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
openCryptoki 2.4.1 allows local users to create or set world-writablepermissions on arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the (1)LCK..opencryptoki or (2) LCK..opencryptoki_stdll file in /var/lock/.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4455` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopencryptoki0 - 3.4.1+dfsg-1
opencryptoki - 3.4.1+dfsg-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: opencryptoki package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.1+dfsg-1').
